Description: Red jasper gem engraved with a seated Sarapis wearing a calathos and holding a sceptre; at his feet is an eagle (?). On the left is Athena with helmet, shield and spear; on the right is Fortuna with a cornucopia and steering-oar, and Hermes with a caduceus; his left hand is grasped by a kneeling figure, perhaps a soul.
Bibliographic references: Gem / Catalogue of Engraved Gems & Cameos, Greek, Etruscan & Roman in the British Museum (1776)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1997, Milan, Palazzo Reale, Isis: The Myth, The Mystery, The Magic
